availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew Deam Jr. (Lyon County, Kentucky, blacksmith)

body.p: Lyon County, Kentucky, blacksmith. Native of Bavaria, Germany. Son of Andrew Deam Sr. and Catherine Deam. Married to Mary Deam. Father of Andrew Deam, Elizabeth Deam, Amelia Deam, and Mary S. Deam. Student in Clark County, Ohio, in 1850. Blacksmith in Eddyville, Kentucky, in 1860. Blacksmith in Christian County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Clark County, Mad River, p. 78B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, Eddyville, p. 766.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Texas, Dallas County, Precinct 2, p. 348A-B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Christian County, KY, July 1863, p. 31 of 629 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "Andrew Deam (1834-1906)," Memorial #7713826, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/7713826 (accessed March 18, 2021).
